section.title: OpenStack Services
section.p: The following services are foundation technologies used by HPE Helion OpenStack
Compute Operations Learn how the Compute (Nova) service manages the hypervisors and virtual machines in your environment.
Identity Learn about the Identity Management (Keystone) service used to create and administer users and security groups, and to control access to your cloud environment.
Image Operations Learn about the Image Operations (Glance) service to create and maintain server images.
Networking Operations) Learn about the Networking (Neutron) service to create and manage virtual networks.
Object Operations Learn about the Object Operations (Swift) service to store and retrieve data.
Orchestration. Learn about the Orchestration (Heat) service to create templates that describe the infrastructure for a cloud application.
Volume Operations Learn about the Volume Operations (Cinder) service to attach storage volumes to the virtual instances.
Metering. Learn about the Metering (Ceilometer) service to collect measurements throughout your cloud environment.
Ceph Learn about Ceph, an open source, scalable, software defined storage running on HPE Servers which provides block and object storage with unified management.

section.title: HPE Services
section.p: The following services have been developed by HPE for use with the HPE Helion OpenStack
Sirius Learn about the Sirius service for the configuration of storage services.
EON Learn about the ESX on border (EON) service for interacting with the VMware vCenter server.
Sherpa Learn about the Sherpa service to access a repository of software that can be purchased and downloaded into the Cloud OS environment.

section.title: Dashboard services
section.p: HPE Helion OpenStack uses the following services or software to present user interfaces to aspects of HPE Helion OpenStack
Horizon Learn about the Horizon dashboard to create and manage HPE Helion OpenStack resources.
Icinga Learn abou the Icinga service to monitor the disk usage of Swift storage node(s).
Kibana Learn about the Kibana service to view logging data across the HPE Helion OpenStack cloud.

section.title: Installation services
section.p: The following services are used only during the HPE Helion OpenStack installation:
TripleO Learn about TripleO to facilitate the installation of an OpenStack cloud.
Ironic Learn about the Ironic service for provisioning of the controller and KVM compute host in a baremetal deployment.

section.title: Other services and features
section.p: The following services and features can be used with HPE Helion OpenStack
Centralized Logging Learn about the Centralized Logging service to collect logs throughout the cloud into a central system.
DNSaaS Learn about the HPE Helion OpenStack DNSaaS (Domain Name System as a Service)to display, create, modify, and delete DNS records on the assigned DNS server network.
